clues.text: In December 1993 Toni Morrison became the first African-American woman awarded this international literature prize

(We now return you to Sarah in the TRL studios in New York.) Once a backup singer for the likes of Faith Evans and Puff Daddy, she's hit 'em up good ever since. Take a look..."From the crib to the ride and the clothes; so you better let him know..."
